parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system can cause extended stopping distances, loss of control, and accidents, which can lead to injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The ABS system malfunctions
causing the vehicle to take longer to stop
the brake pedal to travel to the floor
or the vehicle to pull to one side while braking. Some complainants reported a sudden loss of braking power
while others experienced a delay in braking response.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake pedal can cause the vehicle to surge forward, leading to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal sticks to the floor
or the brake pedal does not return to its normal position.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake rotors and pads can cause the vehicle to pull to one side while braking, leading to loss of control and accidents.
symptoms: The brake rotors overheat and warp
causing the vehicle to pull to one side while braking. The brake pads wear out quickly
requiring frequent replacement.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Clutch and Brake Hydraulic System Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch and brake hydraulic system can cause the clutch pedal to stick to the floor, making it difficult or impossible to shift gears, and the brake pedal to travel to the floor, leading to extended stopping distances and accidents.
symptoms: The clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
the clutch pedal sticks to the floor
or the brake pedal travels to the floor.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the windshield wiper motor can cause the windshield wipers to work intermittently or not at all, reducing visibility while driving, especially in rainy or snowy conditions, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: The windshield wipers work intermittently
the windshield wipers only work on high speed
the windshield wipers do not work at all
the windshield wipers stop working during performance.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system can cause loss of control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Intermittent loss of power steering
particularly at low speeds
unintended power assist that pulls the vehicle in the opposite direction
total loss of power steering
steering wheel locks up for a second before loosening up and going out of control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake system can cause loss of control, making it difficult or impossible to stop the vehicle, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal goes all the way to the floor
brake failure
poor braking performance
brake fluid leaking
tires wearing out quickly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the clutch system can cause loss of control, making it difficult or impossible to shift gears, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Clutch pedal feels soft or spongy
clutch pedal sticks to the floor
clutch pedal does not return to its normal position
clutch pedal has a delayed return to its normal position
clutch pedal has a sudden loss of pressure
vehicle is unable to shift into gear.
